sentences.sContent: "Put down pugilism - if I have to wear it night and day, " said the Moral Sentiment of the Community, sternly.
sentences.sContent_eng: "Put down pugilism - if I have to wear it night and day, " said the Moral Sentiment of the Community, sternly.
sentences.sCn: “如果我要日夜带着它的话，我要镇压拳击运动。” 德先生坚决的说。

sentences.sContent: And unlike mainstream pugilism, fighters can win by not only knocking out their opponent, but also by catching them in checkmate.
sentences.sContent_eng: And unlike mainstream pugilism, fighters can win by not only knocking out their opponent, but also by catching them in checkmate.
sentences.sCn: 和主流拳击赛不同，挑战者不仅要在拳击中击败对手，而且还要在棋赛中置其于“死地”。

sentences.sContent: "That's right, " said the Pugilist, "that is right, my good friend; if pugilism had been put down yesterday, I wouldn't have this kind of Nose to-day.
sentences.sContent_eng: "That's right, " said the Pugilist, "that is right, my good friend; if pugilism had been put down yesterday, I wouldn't have this kind of Nose to-day.
sentences.sCn: “这是一个正确之举”，拳击手说道，“这真是一个正确之举，我亲爱的朋友，如果拳击运动昨天就被镇压了的话，今天我的鼻子就不会这副模样了。

trans.tranOther: the art, practice, or profession of fighting with the fists; boxing
